solution_line_template: Wendi doubled her number of chickens from {initial_chickens} to {initial_chickens}*{double_factor}=<<{initial_chickens}*{double_factor}={chickens_after_doubling}>>{chickens_after_doubling} chickens.
After a dog ate one of the chickens, {chickens_after_doubling}-{dog_ate}=<<{chickens_after_doubling}-{dog_ate}={chickens_after_dog}>>{chickens_after_dog} chickens remained.

Therefore, Wendi added another 4 less than ten chickens for a total of {chickens_after_dog}+{additional_chickens_found}=<<{chickens_after_dog}+{additional_chickens_found}={final_chickens}>>{final_chickens} chickens.
